text: Charles B. Wang (August 19, 1944 â€“ October 21, 2018) was an American businessman and philanthropist. He was a co-founder and CEO of Computer Associates International, Inc. (later renamed to CA Technologies). He was a minority owner (and past majority owner) of the NHL's New York Islanders ice hockey team. A philanthropist, he donated to charities including SmileTrain. Wang died of lung cancer at his home in Oyster Bay, New York on October 21, 2018 at the age of 74.https://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2018/10/21/us/ap-us- obit-wang.html ==References== Category:1944 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from lung cancer Category:Cancer deaths in New York (state) Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:American philanthropists Category:American computer scientists Category:Engineers from New York (state) Category:Businesspeople from New York (state) Category:Scientists from New York (state) Category:People from Shanghai
title: Charles Wang
